item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, April 17, 2025 at 3:00 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Zoom outage caused by accidental 'shutting down' of the zoom.us domain (148 points | 80 comments)
2. Jellyfin as a Spotify alternative (155 points | 121 comments)
3. Demolishing the Fry's Electronics in Burbank (69 points | 32 comments)
4. OpenAI Codex CLI: Lightweight coding agent that runs in your terminal (342 points | 194 comments)
5. Darwin's children drew all over the “On the Origin of Species” manuscript (2014) (336 points | 100 comments)
6. Show HN: Plandex v2 – open source AI coding agent for large projects and tasks (71 points | 19 comments)
7. 12-factor Agents: Patterns of reliable LLM applications (250 points | 45 comments)
8. Damn Vulnerable MCP Server (158 points | 49 comments)
9. TLS certificate lifetimes will officially reduce to 47 days (380 points | 505 comments)
10. Unix files have (at least) two sizes (34 points | 9 comments)
11. Man who built ISP instead of paying Comcast expands to hundreds of homes (2022) (336 points | 152 comments)
12. "Vivarium": The keeper of a lab's animals stumbles onto a secret [fiction] (11 points | discuss)
13. How a Forgotten Battle Created a More Peaceful World (61 points | 19 comments)
14. Concurrency in Haskell: Fast, Simple, Correct (9 points | 1 comment)
15. Query Engines: Push vs. Pull (2021) (40 points | discuss)
16. How Nintendo bled Atari games to death (176 points | 125 comments)
17. OpenAI o3 and o4-mini (439 points | 405 comments)
18. OneSignal (YC S11) Is Hiring Engineers ( | hide)
19. Kermit: A typeface for kids (266 points | 137 comments)
20. Astronomers Detect a Possible Signature of Life on a Distant Planet (105 points | 68 comments)
21. eInk Mode: Making web pages easier to read (88 points | 36 comments)
22. Nix Trigonometric Math Library from Ground Zero (10 points | discuss)
23. Breaking the Llama Community License (118 points | 65 comments)
24. Reproducing Hacker News writing style fingerprinting (220 points | 103 comments)
25. CVE Foundation (296 points | 61 comments)
26. Sony Unveils the Smallest and Lightest Lidar Depth Sensor (25 points | 5 comments)
27. RakuAST Grant Report (40 points | 2 comments)
28. Tech workers are leaving notes in robot taxis seeking workers and lovers (78 points | 66 comments)
29. Microsoft researchers developed a hyper-efficient AI model that can run on CPUs (77 points | 21 comments)
30. A high-throughput parser for the Zig programming language (106 points | 8 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, April 17, 2025 at 3:00 AM UTC
